alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Jefferson; Pottawatomie; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 11:18PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jefferson, northwestern Shawnee, northern Wabaunsee, southeastern Pottawatomie, Jackson and Brown Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of White Cloud to near Circleville to 4 miles southeast of Wamego. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holton, Hiawatha, Horton, Rossville, Alma, St. Marys, Silver Lake, Hoyt, Maple Hill, Mayetta, Everest, McFarland, Robinson, Paxico, Belvue, Emmett, Whiting, Denison, Circleville and Delia. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 323 and 354. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
